definitions: intense feeling of dislike or hostility toward someone or something
examples: Years of conflict bred deep hatred between the groups
She couldn't hide her hatred for injustice

definitions: decorative items worn for personal adornment, such as rings or necklaces
examples: The antique jewelry collection was worth millions
She kept her grandmother's jewelry in a special box

definitions: movement of people or animals from one region to another
examples: Bird migration occurs twice yearly between seasons
Human migration shaped the development of civilizations

definitions: creation of something new that did not exist before
examples: The invention of the wheel transformed human society
Her latest invention won first prize at the fair

definitions: action of hurting someone in return for being hurt
examples: He sought revenge for his brother's death
Revenge often leads to more conflict and pain

definitions: holiday celebrated October 31st with costumes and trick-or-treating
examples: Children dressed as ghosts and witches for Halloween
Halloween decorations appeared in stores by September

definitions: person who is loved romantically or very dear to someone
examples: He married his high school sweetheart
She called her grandson her little sweetheart

definitions: person who protects someone or something from attack or harm
examples: The lawyer acted as a defender of civil rights
The team's best defender blocked the goal attempt

definitions: edible seed that grows underground in pods
examples: Peanut butter sandwiches are popular with children
Some people have severe allergies to peanuts

definitions: session of physical exercise or training
examples: Her morning workout includes running and weights
The team had an intense workout before the game

definitions: uncultivated and uninhabited area left in its natural condition
examples: They hiked deep into the wilderness for solitude
Protecting wilderness areas preserves biodiversity

definitions: area of land behind a house, often used as a garden
examples: The children played in the backyard all afternoon
We planted tomatoes in our backyard garden

definitions: person who legally cares for someone unable to manage their affairs
examples: The court appointed her aunt as her legal guardian
He served as guardian of the family fortune

definitions: sacred writings of a religion, especially the Bible
examples: The preacher quoted scripture during the sermon
Many find comfort reading scripture during difficult times

definitions: middle point or part of something in time or space
examples: In the midst of chaos, she remained calm
The cabin stood in the midst of tall pines

definitions: quality of being aware of and responsive to feelings or changes
examples: Her sensitivity to others' emotions made her a good counselor
Skin sensitivity increases with certain medications

definitions: device that releases a spring or catch to fire a gun
event or situation that causes something to happen or begin
examples: Pull the trigger slowly for better accuracy
Keep your finger off the trigger until ready
Loud noises can trigger anxiety in some people
The incident triggered a series of protests

definitions: continuous pain in the head
person or thing that causes worry or trouble
examples: She took aspirin for her splitting headache
Stress often causes tension headaches
Parking downtown is always a headache
Tax preparation gives me a headache every year

definitions: person's sense of self-esteem or self-importance
examples: His enormous ego made him difficult to work with
Success inflated her ego beyond reason

definitions: sum of money placed in a bank or paid as security
layer of a substance that has accumulated naturally
examples: Make a deposit at the bank before noon
The apartment requires first and last month's deposit
Mineral deposits formed over millions of years
Calcium deposits clogged the old pipes

definitions: decision reached by a jury or judge in a court case
examples: The jury returned a guilty verdict after deliberation
Everyone awaited the verdict with nervous anticipation

definitions: attention to or concern for something or someone
examples: Show proper regard for others' feelings
She holds him in high regard

definitions: fact or condition of being responsible for actions and decisions
examples: Government accountability ensures transparent use of public funds
The new system increases accountability at all levels

definitions: detailed analysis and assessment of something, especially literary or artistic work
examples: The professor's critique highlighted both strengths and weaknesses
She wrote a thoughtful critique of the new exhibition

definitions: passage between rows of seats or shelves
examples: Walk down the aisle to find your seat
Grocery aisles were crowded before the holiday

definitions: destructive wave of highly compressed air from an explosion
very enjoyable experience or event
examples: The blast shattered windows for miles around
Workers used blast techniques to clear the rock
The party was an absolute blast
We had a blast at the amusement park

definitions: sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings of others
examples: The nurse showed great compassion to her patients
Teaching children compassion creates a kinder society

definitions: person who commits an illegal act or breaks a rule
examples: First-time offenders often receive lighter sentences
The program helps young offenders avoid prison

definitions: thick, solid piece of something
examples: Cut the cheese into small chunks for serving
A large chunk of ice broke off the glacier

definitions: recognition and enjoyment of the good qualities of someone or something
examples: She expressed appreciation for their hard work
Art appreciation requires understanding cultural context

definitions: strong cloth used as a surface for painting
heavy-duty fabric used for tents, sails, or bags
examples: The artist stretched canvas over the wooden frame
She painted her masterpiece on a large canvas
The tent was made of waterproof canvas
Canvas bags are durable and eco-friendly

definitions: strike with the fist
drink made from fruit juice mixed with water or soda
examples: The boxer delivered a powerful punch
He wanted to punch the wall in frustration
Serve fruit punch at the children's party
The wedding featured a champagne punch

definitions: series of events or actions taken in a formal meeting or legal process
examples: Court proceedings lasted for three weeks
The conference proceedings will be published next month

definitions: ceremonial chair for a sovereign or high-ranking official
examples: The queen sat upon her golden throne
He abdicated the throne to marry

definitions: information, especially biased, used to promote a political cause or viewpoint
examples: Wartime propaganda influenced public opinion significantly
The regime spread propaganda through state media

definitions: expression of meaning through use of language signifying the opposite, often for humorous effect
examples: The irony of the fire station burning down wasn't lost on anyone
She appreciated the irony in his statement

definitions: sweet carbonated drink, also called soft drink or pop
examples: Order a soda with your burger and fries
The vending machine offers various soda flavors

definitions: estimate or forecast of a future situation based on current trends
presentation of an image on a surface, especially a screen
examples: Sales projections for next year look promising
Weather projections show rain all week
The projection on the screen was blurry
Use a digital projection for the presentation

definitions: person who collects things of a specified type as hobby or job
examples: The art collector owned several famous paintings
Stamp collectors meet monthly at the library

definitions: election of someone to a position they already hold
examples: The mayor won re-election by a wide margin
Senators face re-election every six years

definitions: sadness or displeasure caused by non-fulfillment of hopes or expectations
examples: His failure was a huge disappointment to his parents
She tried to hide her disappointment about the cancellation

definitions: person who listens, especially one who does so attentively
examples: Good therapists must be excellent listeners
Radio shows depend on loyal listeners

definitions: sliding storage compartment in furniture that can be pulled out
examples: Keep the silverware in the top drawer
The desk has three drawers on each side

definitions: mild exclamation used to express annoyance or surprise
examples: What the heck happened to my keys?
Heck, I forgot to call her back

definitions: person or thing regarded as perfect or as a standard
examples: She represents the ideal of a dedicated teacher
The weather conditions were ideal for sailing

definitions: powdery residue left after burning of a substance
examples: Volcanic ash covered the entire village
Clean the ash from the fireplace regularly

definitions: room where a court of law holds its sessions
examples: Everyone rose when the judge entered the courtroom
Cameras are not allowed in the courtroom

definitions: small adhesive piece of paper for sending mail
device for impressing a mark or pattern
examples: Buy stamps at the post office
The letter needs two stamps for overseas delivery
Use the date stamp on all documents
The official stamp proved the document's authenticity

definitions: musical piece or performance by one person alone
examples: The guitarist played an amazing solo
She sang a beautiful solo at the concert

definitions: person who trains people or animals
soft shoe suitable for sports or casual wear
examples: The personal trainer designed a custom workout plan
The dolphin trainer worked at the aquarium
Buy new trainers for the gym
These trainers are comfortable for walking
